suncertify

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a wrapper class round a Properties object that holds configuration parameters for the application.

    Instances hold a description of the configuration and descriptions for the key-value pairs of the enclosed Properties object.

    In this way a GUI tool for editing the configuration can determine the type of value and dynamically display field prompts based on the retrieved descriptions.

    Author:
    Nick Shrine

    • Constructor Detail

      • Configuration

        protected Configuration(java.lang.String prefix,
                        java.lang.String[] keys,
                        java.lang.String description)
        Creates a new Configuration specified by a prefix for property keys to be saved with, a set of keys specifying what sort of values are to be stored and a description indicating the mode of operation that this Configuration specifies.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to be used for property keys of this Configuration.
        keys - an array of property keys specifying the sort of values this Configuration stores i.e. an array containing values chosen from FILE_KEY, HOST_KEY, PORT_KEY or any custom keys that may be required.
        description - text that describes the mode of operation this Configuration specifies e.g. "Server" or "Client".

        Returns:

      • getKeyType

        public static java.lang.String getKeyType(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the last part of the key that indicates what type of value it is pointing to.
        Parameters:
        key - they key string that we want to determine the type of.
        Returns:
        the type of this key, built-in key types are FILE_KEY, HOST_KEY and PORT_KEY.
